medical_history.chief_complaint: Right subscapular pain, followed by dyspnea, fever, cough, and hemoptysis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The right subscapular pain started six hours prior to admission and was not relieved by paracetamol and ketoprofen. Symptoms progressed to include dyspnea, fever, cough, and hemoptysis. The patient developed acute neurological deterioration six hours after admission, characterized by a stuporous state and mottled skin.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Paucisymptomatic SARS-CoV-2 infection approximately two months prior. Penicillin allergy.
